page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO GLYNDE
page.content: This is a beautiful rural area. In the South the Honiton-Folkestone trunk road is being straightened and widened below the old road which once went through the village of{Glynde.}To the west,{Mount Caburn}is topped by an iron-age fort, and separates this quiet valley from the ancient county town of Lewes. The area is internationally famous as the breeding ground of the{Southdown {sheep.} To the North, {Glyndebourne} brings music-lovers and musicians from all over the world to what is unique in 1985, an opera house set in a beautiful garden. The little road from Ringmer to Beddingham runs through the area from North to South. Parallel to the A27 is the railway line connecting Lewes with Eastbourne. {Glynde Reach} runs diagonally from North-East to South-West.
